website_summaries.verdict: If you hate iTunes, the SanDisk Clip Jam is the best bargain music player you can buy.
pros: The SanDisk Clip Jam has a lightweight design with a built-in clip, FM radio and long battery life
You can easily copy music from a PC or Mac and the microSD slot provides an extra storage option in a pinch
Unlike the iPod Shuffle, it has a screen
cons: It's not compatible with any streaming music services

customer_reviews.title: Good quality MP3 player, but there's a catch...
customer_reviews.text: This MP3 player is nice, good features, screen shows enough menu options to make browsing a breeze. I did run into an issue where the MP3 player would freeze and sometimes restart when I selected any option on the main screen. After trying to figure out what it would be, I downloaded a firmware update (1.15) and it seems to have fixed it. I would say if you are buying this, do this ASAP! It added a "books" option to the home page and there are a lot more customization options in the settings menu.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Most difficult to use MP3 player i've ever owned. Hard to turn off -- and when it does go off, much of the time it comes right back on again. Sometimes I put it on charge and come back later to discover it has turned itself on and has been running the whole time. I use it for audiobooks, and the most maddening thing is that it often doesn't resume where I left off but will go all the way back to the beginning -- or will start playing a different audiobook altogether! The Clip Plus was an ideal player, easy to use. Why on earth was it discontinued? I'm now looking for a better replacement from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra P.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT birthday present !!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 12th b'day today. His review is below: * It has a lot of storage * Doesn't take long to charge and lasts a long while * Easy-to-carry * Size is perfect * Earplugs very good AND comfortable. The foam helps 🖒
customer_reviews.author: PPencle

customer_reviews.title: Changed for the worse
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Sansa Clip for years. I download books onto my computer and move them to the mp3 player. I listen to them while I work out. Some genius at Sansa decided that all files will be shuffled. So a book starts on chapter 8 and jumps to 23. You get the picture. Shuffle can not be turned off, This device costs something like $30. If you can find an older model that does not shuffle you can get it for about $150. From my point of view they took an excellent product and made it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Trosin

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS GREAT , SHOULD ORDER 2 FOR FUTURE USE...
customer_reviews.text: THE ONLY PROBLEM IS TO REMEMBER TO PLACE MICRO SD CARD IN IT AFTER POWERING UP AND PULL CARD BEFORE POWERING DOWN . AFTER LOADING FILES WITH COMPUTER IT SEEMS TO HAVE USELESS FILES/FOLDERS THAT TAKE UP RELEVANT SPACE FOR MUSIC SO I DELETE. AND CAN LOCK UP ON USING CARDS LARGER THAN 8GB . CAN ALSO PLAY FILE TYPES IT SAYS IN DIRECTIONS IT CANT . I USE MP3 , MP4 AND WAV , DON'T NOW ABOUT FLAC THOUGH . BATTERY LASTS ALONG TIME AS I USE ALMOST EVERY DAY AND HAVE HAD IT NEARLY 6 MONTHS WITH NO DROP OFF IN POWER YET .
customer_reviews.author: Doris W

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Play  Audiobooks from CD in Order
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player to listen to audiobooks that I get as CDs from library. I rip each CD from cda to mp3 format. Then I drag & drop to the Audiobook folder in the player. I label the CDS in order....e.g. Disc 01 with tracks 01, 02, etc. CD #2 would be Disc 02 with tracks 01, 02, etc. Instead of playing the audiobook in hierarchical order as seen in File Explorer on my PC , the player plays ALL the track 01 files, then all the track 02 files etc. Can anyone suggest "how" to make the playe just play in hierarchical order as dragged & dropped?
customer_reviews.author: Phil P.

customer_reviews.title: You wont find a better workout MP3 player.
customer_reviews.text: I cringe when I see people sweat all over their $800-1200 smart phones in the gym. For $30 you couldn't ask for a better mp3 player to abuse. 8 gigs is more than enough for a strong workout playlist. MicroSD is icing on the cake. Support normal directory tree navigation, ie Genre/Band/Album. Where some players "organize" your mp3s into one folder, this allows you to organize it your way. NOTE: Slow file transfers, 1-3 MB/s, but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, stopped working, much better budget mp3s out there.
customer_reviews.text: It's super archaic, but it got the job done - until it broke. Just wouldn't turn on, even after a charge. My main qualm with this, while it worked, was that you have to manually add each song to a playlist, so for instance, I had 200 songs downloaded. About 100 rap, 50 rock, 50 classical, and I had to manually put each one into the corresponding playlist. What's worse is if you hit the up arrow, while at the top of the playlist, you'll jump to the >delete playlist< option, right below the last song. I had to manually re-enter all 100+ rap songs. The AGPTEK A01T 8gb is a step up, don't get this.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Saladino

customer_reviews.title: Great little SanDisk model MP3 player.
customer_reviews.text: This was my 1st SanDisk Clip Jam purchase through Amazon. I purchased 2 locally over the past 5-6 years. I don't know a lot about MP3 players but after research I found this met my needs. Holds J believe up to 6,000 songs but more with the SD card slot. (card not included) Battery is excellent when listening to music/playlists. Listening to the radio seems to drain the battery more quickly. My 2 main reasons for purchasing through Amazon were unavailability locally & I had a free trial of Prime which meant quick delivery. As I stated I had 2 previous SanDisk Clip Jams. It is a very nice little MP3 player & I would definitely recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: ANDY M

customer_reviews.title: Not good for non-Audible audiobooks
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use MP3 audiobooks from the library, downloaded from Overdrive. This player scrambles the files regardless of the way they are uploaded. I followed the instruction concerning the file names (under 16 characters) and location (under Audiobooks). For example, the file marked as Part 1 actually plays Part 5! The playback is rather random. I should have done more research, as apparently this is a problem inherent of many Scan Disc players as far back as 5 years ago... I bought this because it ranked high when I searched for MP3 players for audiobooks, but apparently that's only compatible with Audible books.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk can no longer make MP3 players that work.
customer_reviews.text: I used a Sandisk sansa clip mp3 players for years. Unfortunately the audio connector failed. With the old model I could download audiobooks from my library thru my PC using Overdrive..Audiobook files were always loaded in the correct order. I don't don"t know who makes this unit for Sandisk or perhaps who now owns the company.but audio files are are not in the correct order. Sandisk support would like me to open these files on my PC and convert them. Amazon is allowing me to return it. I would be concerned about buying from Sandisk it the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Posner

customer_reviews.title: Only one channel worked
customer_reviews.text: I used to really like the old versions of the Sansa Clips. I use them hours each day listening to audiobooks and podcasts. My old version finally died after thousands of hours of use, so I bought another. They changed the interface. It may be that I am just accustomed to the old system, but I really don't like the new system. The controls are harder to operate and less intuitive to use, and the included earbuds are awful. Beyond that, one channel did not work at all. I suspect a faulty jack, but you can't open the unit, so it's garbage. I definitely would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: I love it for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I have a love/hate relationship with the Sandisk Clip Jam. As an avid runner, I love it for what it is. It tiny, portable to the max, lightweight, fits all my music with a perfectly decent battery life. However, this thing will only last 2 to 3 months tops before something on it inevitably breaks. More then often, the buttons will just stop working one day. My last one decided it just didn't want to play music anymore and when I try to access the player it just freezes and restarts. I'm probably on my 5th Sandisk Clip after having tried other MP3 players. Ill probably pay another one, knowing full well I'll probably buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but don't believe you'll get the sd card w/ the green one.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for audiobooks. It took some getting used to to get this to work properly for audiobooks, but now I know that a full path needs to be put in when a book is transferred, it's all good. (All books should be put in this folder: \audiobooks\author\booktitle . Do *not* neglect to put in the book title before transferring the parts or every book from that author will get mixed together in that author folder.) What I'm annoyed about is that I bought the green one which currently *supposedly* comes w/ the 32gb microsd card. It didn't.
customer_reviews.author: c'est moi

customer_reviews.title: ok but not as good as shuffle
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my apple shuffle (no longer manufactured) so that is what I have to compare it with. Its plastic, shuffle is metal. Does not have a lock, shuffle does, and if you put it in your pocket like I do, you need it to lock, otherwise the button will get pressed. .Holds a charge for about half the time the shuffle does. Earbuds are not good quality, nothing like the apple that is designed to actually fit in your ear. update 3/18/18: Forgotten to mention in the comparison: Half the price of an apple shuffle! And it's still working just fine!
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: but am happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the Sandisk Clip for a few months, but am happy with it. My biggest concern with MP3 players is durability and the jury will be out on this for a few years. I use the MP3 players for running outside and some make it 6 months while others last 3 years. I didn't use the ear buds that came with this, so have no comment. I do like how easy it is to download songs from Media Player. The battery life is great- it last a few weeks for my every other day 30-45 minute runs. I've always had an arm band, but I started cliping this to the back of my hat and love it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bianco

customer_reviews.title: Device died in 2 days - zero stars
customer_reviews.text: So, the MP3 player was delivered on Tuesday - and was totally dead by Thursday. And we hadn't even taken it out of the house. Day 1 was OK - loaded a dozen MP3 songs on the unit, and charged it via PC. Day 2, the device decided it just would not take a charge or turn on. Day 3, Amazon is taking the return back without question. Shame on SanDisk for marketing such a weak product. The unit never made it past my home desk where it was opened, plugged in to my PC, and died. A short, unsatisfying life for this little product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoneddy

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO READ DISPLAY! EVEN IF YOU HAVE OLD EYES IT CAN BE READ BY THE YOUNG AT HEART!
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot more than the more expensive one's I bought!!! At night in dim light the others were hard to read. Almost everything about this mp3 player towers about the others. Only negative was not enough instructional material came with it. I like feeling and filing instructions rather than searching for them on the internet! Could have started learning everything sooner, right out of the box. All the other players had this fault in addition to many others! I'd give this player an A-! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Zip

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as intended
customer_reviews.text: Was not able to download any songs unless they were in MP3 format although it indicated that it could handle other formats like AAC. Downloaded about 20 songs but won't allow me to play the songs keep indicating that it was synching or uploading (or something like that) for days. Erase and start over but it did the same thing. Looks like a may need some tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Karen E. Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Wothless
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge fan of M240 series. At one time I think I had 4 of them! They were durable, compact and most of all, you could operate them without looking at them. This model is basically a holder of music files. I could not get a playlist to transfer in full and trying to compose a playlist on it would take forever and a day. No thank you.
customer_reviews.author: dreamer_rt

customer_reviews.title: Back to the Future
customer_reviews.text: I'm a runner so I want a super lightweight mp3 player. I don't want to strap a big brick of a phone to my arm. My previous Clip Jam of 3 years finally died due to water damage. I tried several other mp3 players on Amazon most of which had decent sound but horrible menu navigation and screen contrast (I couldn't see the screen when running during the day). I finally went back to what worked and got a new Clip Jam. The sound is good, screen is readable in the daylight, and the menu intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: B. King

customer_reviews.title: A lto for the price
customer_reviews.text: It has reasonable battery life, the controls are reasonably intuitive. Not super intuitive, but you can figure them out. The radio actually works. I am no audiophile, but the player sounds pretty good to me. It seems loud enough, and I have used it to listen to books on tape as ell as music. So I am very satisfied with it. One complaint: you can accidentally turn it on in your pocket or backpack if something pushes against the "on" button.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Finbar Graham

customer_reviews.title: Old school audio dude
customer_reviews.text: I had an MP3 player that would go through batteries way too quick and they weren't rechargeable. This one will pay for itself in no time with the rechargeable batteries, and the battery life is awesome! Love being able to download my music and my audio downloads to listen to. Clips to my shirt and it has a timer, so I can set it for my lunch to wake up in time to go back to work! So small and easy to carry...I use it to play along to guitar and harmonica...totally fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One step forward, two steps back.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, but they should not have taken out the recording feature. Syncing is occasionally quirky and drag & drop sometimes results in odd file behavior, organization, etc. I use mine with MediaMonkey. Podcasts end up in the music folder instead of books. Not sure if it's mediamonkey's default or what, but it's a bit confusing. Oh, and I wish they could just play all the podcasts through, one after another. Instead it stops and you have to go back through the menu to find another podcast. The Clip Plus was a better player, IMO. For podcast-only, I may go back to ipod shuffle, though FM radio is sometimes nice to have on this.
customer_reviews.author: cspan

customer_reviews.title: While they work they are excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Sansa clips are the best mp3 players for the gym. Sansa does continue to degrade the quality of their clip products. I have a 10 year old original clip that works fine. in fact, it went through a wash/dry cycle 7 years ago, still worked. I have had 3 clip jams. One worked for two years, second never even turned on, third died on 17th day, Amazon sending an immediate replacement. Amazon has 30 day return. Sansa says it covers longer period. Sansa customer service does not respond. I think this must be an unusual failure rate but now keep a backup mp3 player in gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Cheap - Small - Good sound quality - Good brand - MicroSD card slot: It says it can take 16GB cards, but I use a 64GB card in mine. Cons: - Cheap - The UI isn't always intuitive, especially when locking the buttons - I've had some problems with turning it on, and had to email Sandisk. They walked me through updating the OS. It works fine now. - There's a noticeable buzzing when you're charging it and using it at the same time - Sometimes it doesn't display the full album title for some reason Buy it if you're looking for an mp3 player that's just good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight, long battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SanDisk. The first one lasted about 9 years until I lost it was was performing flawlessly the last time I used it. This new one looks to be no different in performance. Takes a charge fast,easily to load music on to it, stays charged an impressively long time. Highly recommend this product. The earbuds that come with it are okay and do the job, but I prefer something that hangs on to my ear a little better, so I've ordered some other wired earphones for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery is dead
customer_reviews.text: This is my second piece, the first one I returned because it’s defective after a few days use it just turned off, I had it replaced with the same hoping this one is better. I like the size, the functionality and the sound is quite good for the price but the battery is dead now, I just had this last April and now It’s not charging anymore, I don’t know if I can even retrieve my books and playlist in the internal memory.
customer_reviews.author: Silver

customer_reviews.title: love my little ClipJam
customer_reviews.text: I've been through two iPods, the lovely little square ones they dont make any more, whose screens eventually died and are now useless and Apple no longer makes them. This Clipjam is perfect for working out, walking, travel, etc. i only need music, the radio and podcasts and it works great for all of those. if you want a small sized clip on and dont need a screen for videos, this little player is perfect, and can be hidden in your waistband, its not a huge device that gets strapped to your arm. Oh, and the sound is good too!
customer_reviews.author: vast

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two-Both Failed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my twin 12 year old boys in December 2016. Both ended up breaking. The first lasted one week and Amazon replaced it promptly (and is still working right now). The second died six months later (06/2017) and SanDisk will not respond my RMA requests. They don't seem interested in honoring their printed "one year warrenty" claims. I will no longer be a SanDisk consumer. Broken electronics, broken hopes for my kids. Shame on Sandisk!
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 month!!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond angry!!! I had a refurbished Sandisk 2 Gig MP3 player for 8 years for and I put it through a lot. So I thought I can't go wrong with a brand new one! I read the reviews and just hoped I'd get a good one. Well it died on me after a month and this one was coddled compared to what I put my old one through. I am so angry I am going to ship that thing to corporate headquarters and tell them exactly what I think of their product. I am going to go and order a refurbished one again. The headphones worked fine, so I am keeping those.
customer_reviews.author: Dazed and Confused

customer_reviews.title: good with audio books
customer_reviews.text: This brand is the only affordable player I have found for downloadable library audio books. This is the 3rd one I've bought. I have little issues with every one of them, but overall they give me what I need. My biggest issue has to do with tagging in some books. Once I figured out a way to deal with that, I was happy. There's also an issue with volume on some books. Even with the volume control on high, some books are too quiet to use with speakers (headphones are OK).
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy It!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item from Amazon some time ago. All was going nicely until the player decided to switch it's language to Arabic. I do not read Arabic and contacted SanDisk. They told me that they do not provide "live" troubleshooting via telephone and that I would have to get help via email. Once Sandisk's "fix" arrived I tried to reinstall the OS and the unit went completely dead. No CPR, no external defibrillation, no shot of epinephrine directly to the heart! The sucker is dead and I'm out about $40-50 bucks. No more Sandisk for me....ever!
customer_reviews.author: John in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Dead after 3 months. Product was ordered 1/1/17. While not the most intuitive interface, especially if you want a playlist, I am a bit tech savvy and could work with it. After 3 months, the device will boot up, then just randomly start cycling through the menu, turns the volume down and becomes unresponsive. I tried the software update, but that made no difference. Unfortunately it is outside of Amazon's 1 month return policy. I am trying to return it to Sandisk and am awaiting their response.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasC

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for audiobooks. It holds as many as I want, which is usually at least 8, 10-12 hour books. It would hold more if it didn't take me so long to choose the books I want to listen to. This is probably my 8th SanDisk mp3 player. I use them every day- walking, driving, cleaning the house or pulling weeds. The products are easy to work with uploading on the computer. The battery on Clip Jam the BEST ever!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great for the 3 days it worked
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loved it. Great sound quality, good battery life, small and able to carry tons of songs, able to receive radio stations. Unfortunately, after the 3rd day it would totally freeze up. No buttons worked, couldn't even turn it off, had to wait until the battery died. Also, had some weird looking digital gibberish on the screen. Returned to Amazon, waiting on refund. Really disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Not moisture proof
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product, good sound, easy to use, then it just stopped working. Returned it and got a replacement, worked fine for a while, just past the return date, then it started to decrease the volume by itself so no sound. Now it works sometimes. What a disappointment. Update: i kept trying to use it since it did work sporadically. I finally wondered if the problem could be moisture. I sweat a lot when i run and i had been wearing it clipped to my shirt in front. Since i switched it to clip on the back of my shirt collar, I've had no problems!
customer_reviews.author: JRR

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace aging I-pod. Was pleasantly surprised at the quality of sound and ease of putting my music from PC to the clip, literally only took minutes for over 250 songs!! Initial trying to find combination of control buttons took a little bit (Suggestion,to SanDisc-make the instructions mores detailed and clearer). This is easily a match for the Apple product at 1/3 the cost.
customer_reviews.author: CRAWDAD

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for podcasts!
customer_reviews.text: Small form factor, effective UI, easy to use. Sounds bad. Don't bother pairing with nicer headphones or higher bit rate audio files. Can't drive bass. A bit tinny. You're mostly hearing the mids. Mine came with stuff on already, probably a returned item? Something to watch out for! If you can charge it without connecting to a computer, do so first, then factory reset, before connecting to computer is probably safer.
customer_reviews.author: Gargamel

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for mini ipods!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my mini ipod (the ones that Apple does not carry anymore). It's a fine replacement. Small, easy to use, and friendly price. The earphone they provided kinda suck so I just plug in the Apple's earphone, works out much better than the Sandisk's. The USB charger doesn't come with plugs, so I just hook the USB on my ipod's plug. It holds more songs, and no stupid itune to mess around with. Just dump in all the songs from folder to folder, and it's done. I wish they provide a better quality earphone and an adapter plug, which would take them to 5-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Best mp3 player I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Lots of options but still very easy to use. This unit has very good sound and ample volume, the last few of these I bought I could hardly get volume out of. I don't like the volume blaring but some of my music is not as loud so I need more volume for them. Granted this one doesn't belt the volume out on them but it is plenty of volume to hear. The radio works good. The device automatically filters by artist and album which is a serious plus. Battery life is great and it charges fast.
customer_reviews.author: RustyJD

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review - Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We did purchase this from the Amazon Warehouse so it was not new when we got it.. After about 4 months the battery completely died and the clip snapped off. It worked well while it was working, but as far as durability the rating is low. It is portrayed as a device for active users not a "dainty" player. So for ~$25 maybe that's what you can expect. We just purchased an OakCastle to replace it. So that's $50 on MP3 players.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk is gaining a lifelong fan
customer_reviews.text: I did an overly large amount of research looking into these, certain they would not be as good as promised, and then finally bought one. And then another one. For the price you can't beat it. Easy to use, holds a charge a decent amount of time and is pretty durable (I drop mine a lot). I wanted a tiny little media player that I could listen to while falling asleep, my dad wanted music for while he is working doing manual labor (a lot of lifting and moving around), and this has worked for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: GamesBookstore

customer_reviews.title: severely lacking function
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Sandisk player I've owned over the past several years. This one is severely lacking in basic function and usability. I have a folder substructure for my music (ex: jazz->artist->album) but you can only play per folder and not play all in the jazz folder or artist folder. So I downloaded a program to batch tag mp3 genres. Then realized this player can't play by genre either. Also if you use the additional microsd card the main shuffle doesn't recognize and add it, it can only play manually by folder. Or you have to manually create playlists. This player just isn't worth the money or the time to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband this MP3 Player to use at the gym. It seems to be holding up well and it's easy to load songs onto it. The player is very small, so you can clip it onto your belt or put it in your pocket or just place it in the cup holder or other storage unit while you're using it. The sound is good; it's loud enough to hear over other noise when you use it with headphones.
customer_reviews.author: coco

customer_reviews.title: Great except for audiobooks
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for music and podcasts, but my major gripe was with audiobooks. If I had an audio file longer than an hour and I tried to fast forward, rewind, and even unpause, it wouldn't respond for a minute. An actual minute, not exaggerated. And if I pressed play again while I was waiting, it would start playing after a minute then pause right after. Very frustrating. This device lasted me about 15 months, before it suddenly stopped working. I am able to access the information on my device, but I can't play anything anymore.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect MP3 Player for Gym
customer_reviews.text: Rec'd a defective unit. Notified the seller and they immediately sent a replacement, no questions asked. Excellent customer service. I've been using this model MP3 player for years. My last unit lasted about 3 full years. It never fails, is easy to maneuver, a perfect weight/size for the gym, and a great price. Battery life is also excellent. If you're a gym rat like I am, or even a runner or other exercise enthusiast, this is the perfect MP3 player for you. Very highly recommended device and great customer service with this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound
customer_reviews.text: This is already the second one I bought. I like this product and the other one lasted a long time. The only thing I don't like on the new version is the way you turn it off. The old model had a button on the top you could mash. This one does not have one, so I just have to push at different places until it turns off. I guess one day I will figure it out. But the sound is just as good as it was on the other one, and the price cannot be beaten.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brown

customer_reviews.title: great for exercise / physical jobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this player for my job at UPS, which is basically nonstop physical labor. I didn't want to have to keep up with my phone, and this tiny clip mp3 works great. I've been using it for about a week now, I just clip it on my shirt, shuffle my music and go. Has a good amount of memory already, but I've ordered a 32 gb expansion card to add more. Very simple interface, not the easiest to make playlists on but it's doable. Excellent, reliable player for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after four months.
customer_reviews.text: I used this MP3 player when I worked out at the gym. Average use was about 45 minutes per week. I received this on May 31, 2018 and it froze up and stopped working on Sept 30. It lasted only 4 months then it went belly up. This turned out to be a bad purchase for me. Update, after letting my battery run down to where it shut off, I recharged the battery and everything was fixed. I now revise my review as the problem was reversed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life, easy interface with PC and headphone port.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit for a friend. The micro usb jack is great for charging from your computer or wall charger. 8gig storage is fine if you don't plan on loading it up with a ton of music. Wemadded an additional 16gig memory card and have nearly 3,000 songs stored on it. Has a 1/8" headphone port. Also has a nice feature with the addition of an FM radio.
customer_reviews.author: RIC37012

customer_reviews.title: It Just Went Dead
customer_reviews.text: I went to use it today and it is simply dead. No recognition by the PC or unable to recharge. All appropriate buttons pushed. Nothing. I expect something to last more than one year. Update - I found out that it was still under warranty. I submitted all requested documentation to Sandisk. They acknowledge the receipt of this and then completely went dead. No response. No follow up. So not only was the product faulty, the service was worse
customer_reviews.author: Harris D. Levin

customer_reviews.title: I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. I was excited to receive this, but that faded quickly. When it arrived, I charged it up and went to load some music on it. I could only load a limited amount at a time, which was a bit frustrating, but manageable. The next day I took it with me to listen to some music. Well, it would not even power up. I plugged it in to a USB port thinking maybe the power button had gotten pressed and ran the charge down. Nope. It still wouldn't power up. I even tried a different power supply. I never got to use it even 1 time before it was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my worst purchases ever. It's absurdly tiny, has vague, unresponsive buttons, gets stuck in various modes like "repeat song" and is junk compared to the solid 4GB metal Sansa I used happily for years until the battery died. I tried to revive my old Sansa but got only a stale replacement battery that couldn't hold a charge. I use the players while working out and what used to be a click here and there and back to the workout has become an ordeal.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Shears

customer_reviews.title: One major improvement.
customer_reviews.text: My old Sandisk died, so I bought this one. Oops, my old Sandisk came back to life, so now I have two. I have not put this new one through it's paces yet, but one improvement immediately makes it much better. It now uses a standard charging cable plug. I can use my Samsung phone charging cable to charge this one, no longer need to carry one more cable on my travels. Just based on that alone I give it 4 stars. And of course, in terms of value for money, this can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: bittermelon

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this player for Audible books.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this player if you are listening to Audible (an Amazon company) books. The prior generation of clip + worked great. The jam and sport have a troublesome problem. You hit play on a book to listen and it takes three to four minutes for the play to start. Two days with Sandisk customer service was a bad experience. Just a jargon full waste of time. It should play Audible books if sold on Amazon. Wish that I did not have to write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 15 Year Old

customer_reviews.title: refreshing your media
customer_reviews.text: my player came , we got it all set up and it was fine, until the next morning when i went to use it. i turned it on and it said refreshing your media. all day long. i went online and tried some suggestions to fix it and finally did. the next day it was fine, on the third day, refreshing your media!!!!! i cant fix it again, and i shouldnt have to do this every other day. what a piece of crap, waste of money!!!! oh and of course after i got it all set up, i tossed the packaging away so now i can't return it. so disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: curtis bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but they sent me a used one at the new item price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these I've owned. I love it! However, I purchased a new one, but apparently got a used or "renewed" one - it already had some miscellaneous music and podcasts loaded on it, and the battery life is only about half the claimed 18 hours. If I'd wanted that, I would have ordered a "renewed" one, and saved myself $10.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Wood

customer_reviews.title: One star says it all. Less if I could.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but trouble. It never really downloaded very well - in slow motion, and some times not at all. The latest problem? Suddenly it's not recognized on imac. Went to San Disk site. It says to change the settings to mps or msb (or some such) but the stupid device does NOT have such a thing. Then they suggest reformatting it. I reformatted it. It wiped all the music on the player clean. That's just terrific San Disk. This device has been nothing but a pain. It just went into the trash where it should have gone from the day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Poem

customer_reviews.title: A nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of problems with “file format not supported”, even after Windows Digital Rights Update Tool was run on PC audio files before copying PC audio files to this device. Amazon Help was no help; tried to transfer me to Sandisk, who wouldn’t take the call. Went to Sandisk website for “chat” and got notification “chat not available “. Plus - audio files with format problems on this device can’t be identified nor deleted.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bates

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I do always recommend paying a few $ more to get a warranty from Amazon for electronics when offered because no matter the quality control things will still happen. They always make good on nad products and it's so much easier. It is worth the extra security. Love this so far, got one for my Dad I like it so much. Handy little thing. Works great. Not perfect but nothing is, it's No ipod of course but a nice simple media player. I mostly use it to play my mp3s but my dad also uses the radio on his. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Colette

customer_reviews.title: YOU MUST DOWNLOAD "HIGH QUALITY" AUDIO BOOKS TO GET BOTH LEFT AND RIGHT CHANNELS WORKING!
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this when sound only came out of the right side. After researching on the interwebs, I deleted the books on the player in file explorer AND in the Audiobooks app, went to settings in the Audiobooks app and checked "High Quality Downloads" . I downloaded again and added to the Sandisc and all was good. The player is almost too small. Very little info in the window, but the more expensive player with the larger window gets much lower ratings. I would have gone with the Sony but it is not one of the players shown on the Audiobooks app .
customer_reviews.author: David Henke

customer_reviews.title: Very upsetting
customer_reviews.text: Really upset. I bought a product in the USA from an American website and I received the product programmed in a very different language which I cannot read nor understand it to just change the language! I have no idea now how to use this. I just spent $30 for something I can’t use so I can’t really comment on the quality and use. Also the quick start guide has no real information it tells you to download the user manual online and the link is no longer active it says the page cannot be found. Frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: J K

customer_reviews.title: Sansdisk 8gb mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all for a bare bones mp3 player it's tiny and works well . I even gave it go on my car stereo and the sound quality was pretty good. My only cons I wish the volume level went up slightly higher. Also it wont play alac files I had to covert them to aac no big deal. It may play flac tho. Overall I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until last week......
customer_reviews.text: We were so happy with this....the battery lasted forever! We bought it last year to listen while traveling cross country and it would go as long as we did. But while driving from Michigan to Georgia, we turned it off during routine pit stop and have been unable to get it started again. When buying a lower priced item, we expected a few imperfections but didn’t expect this! Have contacted company and hope to find a trick to get it started again but until then I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not even one star- cheap quality and freezes or shuts down after short period of usage.
customer_reviews.text: Not even one star- this is a replacement item and broke less than two months in- it was a gift for my brother and he's asking me to find an 'older stronger' model if possible- very disappointed by how 'junky' the quality of this item is. Upset because I have older versions I use for my students/children with disabilities for therapeutic listening program who are not always gentle with it and they last very well, and this newer cheaper quality model given to an adult works less than a couple of months before freezing or shutting down completely...
customer_reviews.author: szsilverpoet

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Upgrade from an old SanDisk Sansa for Audible.com books & MP3
customer_reviews.text: I finally replaced my SanDisk Sansa m240 1GB with this player which will allow me to continue to listen to my Audible.com books and MP3 music. Most people are using their smart phones for this type of listening, but I chose not to have a smart phone. I do own a Huawei Android Tablet, but this very small player is must easier to carry and use. Glad I read the reviews of others - the Clip Jam operates quickly and does the job!
customer_reviews.author: P. Wing

customer_reviews.title: I also tried to connect it to my speaker and it was still very low so I'm pretty sure the problem is the mp3
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the headphones are the problem or the mp3 but the volume is very low. I also tried to connect it to my speaker and it was still very low so I'm pretty sure the problem is the mp3. also, when you add new songs you have to look for them in all of the songs in the playlist cause it doesnt have a list of the songs you recently added. there is another problem with this mp3 - it turns off by itself every now and then, even when its full charged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made a great gift for my 8 year old. Will purchase again as gifts.
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect! I wish it was easy to just turn off but it only shuts off automatically after it's been unused. Haven't had any problems. Charging, battery, buttons, lighting and transfers have all been great. Love the size, not super small and not too big. Easy to carry and place anywhere. I've had this for 3 months, so far everything has been consistent. If I didn't already use my phone for tracking my runs and music, I would purchase this just for that. Seems it would work great for workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using to listen to audio books only
customer_reviews.text: The controls are very sensitive and it's easy to bump one that takes me to another chapter or another book. I download books from the library and it's disappointing that the file names used are not always the book title and to it's necessary to create folders instead of the program creating folders for the name of each book.
customer_reviews.author: Dim Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and perfect for our use. We use this for the constantly looping soothing sounds like WhiteNoise while plugged into speakers. It works more dependably and easily than when we used old phones for that purpose. The physical buttons are helpful for pausing and adjusting volume without looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Randyowl

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully engineered, quality design, compact and light, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 10 year old Sansa Clip with this. It is awesome! I purchased mostly to listen to the radio (I know, how old-fashioned) but almost immediately started downloading podcasts since this has ample gigs for that -- plus now I can see the screen. My old Sansa Clip still works but the back-lighting failed when it was about nine years old. Forget the lower-cost spread: this is the one to purchase for great sound, capacity, and longevity. Sansa, I'll be back in 10 years to get a new one!
customer_reviews.author: veronica lake

customer_reviews.title: stopped charging - cant use anymore
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit we purchased and the same thing happened to both! They stopped charging. It cannot be used and the warranty from amazon seems to be over. It's just two months old. I would expect it to last at least a year! Don't even know who to call, Amazon hasn't been of any assistance with this one.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: The worst MP # Player I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Powers on when you charge it, and you can't turn it off until it's done charging. Very poor bass response, and definitely not enough volume output. Now it's started repeating the same song over and over, and I haven't set it to do so. You might as well just throw your money away!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cseko

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Not that many mp3 players out there that have any degree of quality. I have an older version of one of these and the UI is a bit different, maybe confusing, but it's still 'kinda new, so we'll see. The older one is still fine, 'gotta be about 10 years old, hopefully this one will last as long.
customer_reviews.author: miketayse

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Mp3 Player with Radio Data System (RDS) in FM radio !
customer_reviews.text: Good mp3 player and fm radio I discovered Radio Data System (RDS) in FM radio. ( Even Sandisk does not mention it. It displays radio station info and track info. Which is cool to know. Great sound quality - both fm and mp3 tracks. See the picture! Great for gym and non distracted music listening. Saves your mobile phone accidents :-) Needs updated version with voice and fm recording function to get a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Quality has fallen off
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a big fan of SanDisk mp3 players but the quality has gone downhill in the past couple of years. This one lasted just 7 months before the clip broke off. And my previous one would stop working if I sweat too much. It's a shame because these players are great for playing music, podcasts, fm radio, etc. on a run, but the low price isn't worth it if I have to replace it every 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: ... had 2 of these in the past and absolutely love this mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 of these in the past and absolutely love this mp3 player! it is great for its size and its ability to mix and shuffle songs randomly every time. Sound quality and everything about it is just perfect. The only reason I gave this 3 stars, is because the particular mp3 player I was sent, has a very unresponsive power button. Sometimes I have to hassle with the thing for minutes just to power it on.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor M.

customer_reviews.title: Washed and dried - Still worked afterwards
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of days of receiving this MP3 player, my husband forgot to remove it from his pant pocket. So there it went, to the washer and the drier - full ride! My husband was dismayed when I told him. After waiting for a couple of hours, he turned it on again and it actually worked! It's been a month, and it has continued working. Truly amazed by the quality of this player.
customer_reviews.author: JessiMIA

customer_reviews.title: Does not record FM radio.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Clip Zip model and worked great for several years. Bought this one hoping I could record FM radio as well. Nope. Doesn't feel as sturdy either.
customer_reviews.author: B. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for iPod Nano
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed when my iPod nano stopped working and I found out they weren't making them anymore. I'm often in rural areas where there just isn't wi-fi for streaming and need a player like this. I researched many and decided on this one. So far I'm thrilled with it. It was easy plug-and-play in my mac, I downloaded all my songs, and had the player for my fall vacation during my hiking trips. It also hooked up easily into the car so I could listen to my music during my travels. Love it and would recommend it. Great product and great value.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I even dropped it today on cement and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I even dropped it today on cement and it still works...I just wish I could learn how to put music on the thing..Sure you say, hey it's easy..And I'm sure it is..Yet I've spend days and nights trying to do it...I'm old and never done this before. Don't have anyone to show me..'so I'm still just listening to what was already on there...Wish I could find someone to show me..I've been all over Ytube, and done/tried lots of thing..No joy yet..
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Vermillion

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: It didn't last long. It shuts itself off even when the batter is not low. It stopped being recognized by the computer via USB. The old design is was much better, still have 3 of those working well.
customer_reviews.author: steve o

customer_reviews.title: Earlier versions of this player came with an easier way ...
customer_reviews.text: Earlier versions of this player came with an easier way to create playlists. This version requires that you create playlists in Windows media Player which I find to be a HUGE pain-in the -rear. Typically, nothing is mentioned in the information which is available to online shoppers. Deception through exclusion is how I would identify it. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: david boles

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from older model
customer_reviews.text: I've had the older model for years and it worked great but the screen was hard to read in the sunlight and the menus were clunky. But all I needed was a good, cheap little mp3 player to use so I got what I thought was the same model. The new model has better lighting and a better menu to navigate, the sound is good for the price and I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Great product, charge lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for a friend of mine who doesn't have a computer because i liked it so much. I've had 4 of them. My only complaint is about the volume control. I mainly listen to ebooks and if their sound quality is not much, then the player only goes so high and it's sometimes difficult to hear above, say the noise of a fan whirring.
customer_reviews.author: CL Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sandick works great.. put tons of music in it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally a mp3 that actually works..Tried two others over the past month and returned both ..one wouldn't download music, other froze up after it charged. Sandick works great..put tons of music in it and was sooo easy to download. Radio works great too as a good change from my recorded music. Tiny unit but sound is great as well as the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon A. DeLorm

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I did not have to use my expensive ipod or cell phone to listen to music while at the gym. It works great and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Just the Very Best of the MP3 Players!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this one for about 2 years. 1st one lasted about 6 years before the screen went blank...I still use it for back up if my primary runs out of charge, which is almost never. I run and lift weights 6 days a week for 1-3 hours each session. I charge my clip every couple of weeks. These are by far the best of the MP3 players that we have in this house. With 4 kids and 2 adults there are a lot of electronic devices. My youngest has been through 3 (on to her 4th) IPOD's in the same time period as I have been using these 2 Sandisk Clips.
customer_reviews.author: Doclesley

customer_reviews.title: Just died
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when this came in. Light weight, good sound and easy to tranfer music from itunes. One day, it just died. I tried to charge and nothing. I am sending for a replacement and hopefully this one will last. Edit: 10/1/19 the second MP3 player just stopped working. POS
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yet another total failure
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Sansa Clip for as long as it's been available, it's the perfect way to be plugged into NPR during all my waking days. Then it goes dead. Press any combination of buttons, do anything, plug it in, pray upon it... nothing helps. So you replace it. Two months of perfection, then it dies. And again.
customer_reviews.author: Janos Gereben

customer_reviews.title: Better than Good but not Great
customer_reviews.text: I like the Sandisk MP3 players. I bought this one to replace a Sandisk 8GB Clip Zip that I really enjoyed using. I was surprised by how much I liked the Clip Zip because I bought that to replace a Sandisk Fuze that I rated at 5 stars. The only reason I am not giving this 5 Stars is that navigation is more awkward than any of my previous Sandisk players. It takes an extra step to go between the internal storage and externa storage. I listen to music occasionally and this works well for music. I listen to audio books most often and I am very satisfied with its performance with audio books, especially Audible.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: but the last few months it has had terrible reception and hyper-sensitivity to movement at the headphone port ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well at first, but the last few months it has had terrible reception and hyper-sensitivity to movement at the headphone port (e.g., move the headphone cord and it crackles or loses reception entirely). This is hard to endure when you are using this for a jog! It is also no longer holding a charge for more than 1.5 hours and the button to power it off is not recognizing the function request (i.e., doesn't power off, but instead wants to only "pause"). I expected more life out of this lil' guy.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Guidry

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Loved my old Sansa and this one was working great, then almost 1 year to the day it will turn on but wont play Music worse is that I paid for the 2 year warranty from Squaretrade but i am not computer literate enough to file a claim...and I'm pretty computer literate
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good value, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. My hubby works nights and is often alone so he likes to have something to listen to. He loves that you can listen to your saved music, or just tune into the radio if you want. We purchased different earbuds for this because the original ones were not great, but for the price of the player, you can splurge on some nicer earphones and it's not a big deal. Overall this is a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: rliz22

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this new Sandisk player -- try to find one of the older Sandisk Players.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the same Sandisk E260 MP3 Player for 9 years and it is still working fine. So when I wanted another Player to use for exercising, I presumed a new Sandisk version would be even better and improved. WRONG! This device went blank and quit working before I even got a chance to really try it. Also, I realized that it would not even accept all the file types I had been using on my old Sandisk player -- so it actually had reduced capability. And it is very flimsy looking as well. I am returning this item and will try to find another one of the old Sandisk players.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little MP3 Player!
customer_reviews.text: People may question you for wanting an MP3 player in this day and age, but if you have a good reason for one, this is the way to go. The sheer lack of weight and bulk of this device makes it a phenomenal workout/running companion. The clip on the device makes it easy to run with, even without pockets. It feels a bit plasticy, but for the price, I won’t complain. If you’re in the market for an MP3 player, SanDisk is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the three that I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the three that I purchased. However, I was not happy that I was limited to the amount I could buy. It was a drag to have to go to someone else to purchase the other two that I needed. I was buying Christmas presents. They are easy to use and have a good sound. I also purchased the kits for them. I was able to personalize them for each person I was buying for. I was not limited on the amount I purchased on the kits. There were many colors to choose from. I cannot wait to see the kids reaction to them when they open their gifts.
customer_reviews.author: T Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Audible downloads
customer_reviews.text: Only had one issue with the device and it only worked out on one headphone when using audible downloads. Both headphones worked when using the radio for some reason. Didn't work with audible downloads. Tried two devices and both were the same. Love the facts that it works with audible though.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: It acts like a storage drive (with DOS drive letter) when mounted
customer_reviews.text: A worthy successor to the classic "Sansa clip". It acts like a storage drive (with DOS drive letter) when mounted, rather than as a generalized device. Thus you can manage music and other files with Command Language scripts (.cmd files). Ignores irrelevant (non-sound) files so it becomes a multi-purpose storage unit, e.g., to backup .zip files and carry around photos. Good battery life, but this can be extended using an in-line mini-amplifier and/or noise-cancelling headphones (so that it can be operated at reduced primary volume).
customer_reviews.author: Melpomene

product_meta.title: SanDisk 8GB Clip Jam MP3 Player, Black - microSD card slot and FM Radio - SDMX26-008G-G46K
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Capacity:8GB| Style:0.96” TFD-LCD| Pattern Name:MP3 PlayerPut the fun back into music-on-the-go with the compact and colorful Clip Jam digital music player you can clip on and take anywhere. The bright one inch screen and big navigation buttons make it easy to drag, drop and play files in popular audio formats including AAC. Add even more music via the micro SD card slot for up to 18 hours of big sound.
feature_bullets: Super lightweight wearable personal music player
Deep rich sound quality with a built-in micro SD card expansion slot
Play audio files in lots of formats (MP3 WMA (no DRM) AAC (DRM free iTunes) and Audible (DRM only)
Big bright readable screen and large navigation buttons up to 18 hour battery life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars3,858 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
